intro: Cissus loandensis, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and tendrils that aid in climbing. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing on rocky surfaces or in shaded areas. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
